com.soen6441.core.effect

Interface IAffectable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BottleTower, MapItem, MudTower, Road, Tower

    public interface IAffectable
    Any Class wants to have AffectableValue as a property should implement this interface.
    See Also:
    AffectableValue

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String AFFECTABLE_VALUE_NAME_RANGE 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEffect(Effect effect)
      Add an effect.
      AffectableValue getAffectableValue(java.lang.String name)
      Get an affectable value by its name.
      Effect getEffect(java.lang.String type)
      Get an effect by a type name
      void removeEffect(Effect effect)
      Remove an effect Any Effect should call this method to remove it self from the affected object

    • Field Detail

      • AFFECTABLE_VALUE_NAME_RANGE

        static final java.lang.String AFFECTABLE_VALUE_NAME_RANGE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • addEffect

        void addEffect(Effect effect)
        Add an effect. You should check whether there is an stronger effect on the object before you call this method.
        Parameters:
        effect - The effect
        See Also:
        getEffect(String), Effect.strongerThan(Effect)

      • getEffect

        Effect getEffect(java.lang.String type)
        Get an effect by a type name
        Parameters:
        type - Type name
        Returns:
        Return an Effect object, if there is an effect with the type. Return null, if there is not an effect on the object with the same type.

      • removeEffect

        void removeEffect(Effect effect)
        Remove an effect Any Effect should call this method to remove it self from the affected object
        Parameters:
        effect - The effect

      • getAffectableValue

        AffectableValue getAffectableValue(java.lang.String name)
        Get an affectable value by its name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name.
        Returns:
        Return an AffectableValue object if there is an affectable value with the name. Return null if there is not.
        See Also:
        AFFECTABLE_VALUE_NAME_RANGE
